the choice of vaccine for public-health programme in developing country .', 'Hospital-based study have suggested that child younger than 5 year do not need vaccination against typhoid fever , but this view needs to be re-examined in community-based longitudinal study .', 'We undertook a prospective follow-up study of resident of a low-income urban area of Delhi , India , with active surveillance for case detection .', 'Method .', 'A baseline census was undertaken in 1995 .', 'Between Nov 1 , 1995 , and Oct 31 , 1996 , we visited 8172 resident of 1820 household in Kalkaji , Delhi , twice weekly to detect febrile case .', 'Blood sample were obtained from febrile patient , and those who tested positive for Salmonella typhi were treated with ciprofloxacin .', 'Finding .', '63 culture-positive typhoid fever case were detected .', 'Of these , 28 ( 44 % ) were in child aged under 5 year .', 'The incidence rate of typhoid per 1000 person-years was 27.3 at age under 5 year , 11.7 at 5-19 year , and 1.1 between 19 and 40 year .', 'The difference in the incidence of typhoid fever between those under 5 year and those aged 5-19 year ( 15.6 per 1000 person-years [ 95 % CI 4.7-26.5 ] ) , and those aged 19-40 year ( 26.2 [ 16.0-36.3 ] ) was significant ( p < 0.001 far both ) .', 'The difference between the incidence of typhoid at 5-19 year and the incidence at 19-40 year was also significant ( 10.6 [ 6.3-14.8 ] , p < 0 001 ) .', 'Morbidity in those under 5 and in older people was similar in term of duration of fever , sign and symptom , and need for hospital admission .', 'Interpretation .', 'Our finding challenge the common view that typhoid fever is a disorder of school-age child and of adult .', 'Typhoid is a common and significant cause of morbidity between 1 and 5 year of age .', 'The optimum age of typhoid immunisation and the choice of vaccine need to be reassessed.This study was conducted to measure the incidence of typhoid fever among preschooler .', "Making friend in Zurich 's urban forest and park : The role of public green space for social inclusion of youth from different culture .", 'Integrating the distinct culture of foreign resident youth is a challenge for Swiss political and educational institution .', 'An empirical survey of pupil ( n = 437 ) and teacher in selected school of the city and metropolitan area of Zurich investigated leisure activity in urban forest and public green space for their potential to facilitate social interaction between Swiss and immigrant young people .', 'Pattern of socialising and making friend in these outdoor location were found to differ depending on age , school level , gender and the percentage of immigrant in each residential area .', 'Public urban green space were found to play an important role for child and youth in making contact and friend across culture , which is considered a prerequisite for social inclusion .', 'Social impact assessment and public participation in China : A case study of land requisition in Guangzhou .', "This study examines the current prospect for and obstacle facing the implementation of social impact assessment ( SIA ) and participatory planning in the People 's Republic of China .", 'During the past two decade , rapid urbanisation and the conversion of rural land for urban development have led to numerous social conflict and tension between the Chinese government and its people .', 'SIA and public participation in development decision have received increasing attention from the Chinese authority as possible way to tackle the problem .', 'Based on a Guangzhou case study , this paper argues that the assessment and mitigation of adverse impact on the community from urban development have been carried out with different objective , core value and principle when compared with those in Western society .', 'It concludes that the poor prospect of SIA and collaborative planning in China lie not only in the weak framework for environmental legislation , but also in all institution concerning state-society relation , the socialist governing ideology and traditional Chinese culture .', 'Revanchist sanitisation or coercive care ?', 'The use of enforcement to combat begging , street drinking and rough sleeping in England .', "This paper examines recent response to 'problematic street culture ' in England , where increasing pressure has been exerted to prevent people from begging and street drinking in public space , with rough sleeping also targeted in some area .", "Drawing upon in-depth interview with enforcement agent , support provider and targeted individual , it assesses the extent to which the strategy employed are indicative of a 'revanchist expulsion ' of the deviant Other and/or an expression of 'coercive care ' for the vulnerable Other .", 'It concludes that , whilst the recent development appear , at first glance , to be symptomatic of revanchist sanitisation of public space , closer examination reveals that the situation is actually much more complex than a revanchist reading of the situation might suggest , and perhaps not as devoid of compassion .', 'Defining Suburbs .', 'There is no consensus as to what exactly constitutes a suburb .', 'This article examines the range of suburban definition in term of their structure and the topical issue that they grapple with .', 'Suburb have been defined according to many different dimension from location and transportation mode to culture and physical appearance .', 'Given this confusion , one approach is to abandon the term ; another is to use it with greater precision .', 'This is more than just an issue of semantics .', 'Rather how people talk and think about suburb shape how they can see such area being developed and redeveloped in the future .', 'Ethnic minority group and the design of public open scape : An inclusive landscape ?', '.', 'People from ethnic minority group have a range of experience of living in Britain , some of which are significantly different from those of white British people .', 'Previous research and case study suggest that the physical environment has a positive or negative role in perception of everyday life .', 'It is argued that landscape have a symbolic dimension , and aspect of landscape can be recognized as familiar or alien , welcoming or excluding .', 'A wide variety of case study in Britain are used to discuss design and management practice that reflect a range of cultural experience .', 'The need for landscape architect and manager to be aware of how place may be interpreted in different way by different ethnic minority group , and to work towards inclusive design , is highlighted .', 'Urban sustainability transition .', 'The world ’ s population is currently undergoing a significant transition towards urbanisation , with the UN expecting that 70 % of people globally will live in city by 2050 .', 'Urbanisation has multiple political , cultural , environmental and economic dimension that profoundly influence social development and innovation .', 'This fundamental long-term transformation will involve the realignment of urban society ’ s technology and infrastructure , culture and lifestyle , as well as governance and institutional framework .', 'Such structural systemic realignments can be referred to as urban sustainability transition : fundamental and structural change in urban system through which persistent societal challenge are addressed , such as shift towards urban farming , renewable decentralised energy system , and social economy .', 'This book provides new insight into how sustainability transition unfold in different type of city across the world and explores possible strategy for governing urban transition , emphasising the co-evolution of material and institutional transformation in socio-technical and socio-ecological system .', 'With case study of mega-cities such as Seoul , Tokyo , New York and Adelaide , medium-sized city such as Copenhagen , Cape Town and Portland , and nonmetropolitan city such as Freiburg , Ghent and Brighton , the book provides an opportunity to reflect upon the comparability and transferability of theoretical/conceptual construct and governance approach across geographical contexts .', 'Urban Sustainability Transitions is key reading for student and scholar working in Environmental Sciences , Geography , Urban Studies , Urban Policy and Planning .', "Reading landscape meaning : State construction and lived experience in Singapore 's Chinatown .", "The term 'landscape '' embodies multiple level of meaning : it articulates the ideological intent of the powerful who plan or shape the landscape in particular way and at the same time reflects the everyday meaning implicit in the daily routine of ordinary people associated with the landscape .", "Through an analysis of four theme constituting the landscape of Singapore 's Chinatown , we unpack two different but interdependent version of landscape reality : the construction of social meaning from the state 's perspective and those derived from the lived experience of Chinatown 's inhabitant .", "In our first theme , we explore the multiplicity of meaning invested in Chinatown 's housing landscape .", 'For the state , urban renewal and public housing scheme in Chinatown represent the redrawing of landscape along modernist line informed by efficiency and rationality of land use , in tandem with the larger goal of nation-building .', 'Among resident , however , the vision of modern living in everyday life was only a reality for a few ; others experience the landscape in more contradictory way .', 'Second , in the landscape of community building , we show that state-initiated effort at inculcating a sense of community have replaced the old spontaneous , interpersonal tie and the strength of organised vernacular association .', 'Inadvertently , these state strategy have in some way actually been damaging and deleterious to community tie .', 'In our third theme , we show how the state has , to a large extent , successfully rewritten the socially and physically polluted landscape of Chinatown .', "Yet , there are example of resistance where the state 's vision of an unpolluted landscape has been punctured .", "Since the mid-1980s , a fourth imperative has emerged in the state 's management of the Chinatown landscape in the form of attempt to conserve the landscape as a `` historic district '' , a repository of the nation 's tradition , history and culture .", "We show that there are different interpretation of the state 's effort to revitalise Chinese culture in the conserved landscape and its attempt to cast Chinatown in the role of a `` common bond place '' for all Singaporeans .", "Singapore 's Chinatown is thus a multicoded landscape inscribed with a multiplicity of meaning .", 'It is neither used entirely as an ideological tool for manipulative end nor does it fully embody the authenticity of daily experience .', 'Moving young life : Mobility , immobility and inter-generational tension in urban Africa .', "This paper explores young people 's experience and perception of mobility and mobility constraint in poorer urban area of Ghana , Malawi and South Africa within the specific context of inter-generational relation .", "Drawing principally on qualitative research finding from a study involving both adult and child researcher , our aim is to chart the diversity and commonality of urban young people 's mobility experience in the everyday - how they use and experience the city - developing a comparative perspective across three urban study site which links young people 's mobility with the power relation that operate to shape their movement in individual location .", "In particular , we consider how positive and negative image of young people 's mobility play out in term of the inter-generational friction and negotiation generated by their mobility performance .", "We also reflect on the developmental implication , in term of young people 's access to service and income and their participation in the social network and peer culture which may shape their life trajectory .", 'Three theme are explored in detail : mobility as challenge , mobility as temptation and mobility control .', 'From multiculturalism to multinaturalism : What rule of method for the new socio-scientific experiment ?', '.', 'This article reflects on the traditional distinction between scientific laboratory experimenting on theory and phenomenon and a political outside where non-experts make do with human value , opinion , and passion .', 'Since today all people are engaged in emerging collective experiment on matter as varied as climate , food , landscape , health , urban design , and technical communication as consumer , militant , and citizen , they can all be considered co-researchers .', "Co-researching has consequence for our understanding of nature and demands a renewed attention to `` multinaturalist '' politics .", 'It also question the division of labor between expert and nonexperts .', "The article finishes with a call to `` dis-invent '' modernity so that we `` modern '' can finally become ordinary human again .", 'Greater Portland : Urban life and landscape in the Pacific Northwest .', 'It has been called one of the nation ’ s most livable region , ranked among the best managed city in America , hailed as a top spot to work , and favored as a great place to do business , enjoy the art , pursue outdoor recreation , and make one ’ s home .', 'Indeed , year of cooperative urban planning between developer and those interested in ecology and habitability have transformed Portland from a provincial western city into an exemplary American metropolis .', 'Its thriving downtown , its strong neighborhood , and its pioneering effort at local management have brought a steady procession of journalist , scholar , and civic leader to investigate the “ Portland style ” that values dialogue and consensus , treats politics as a civic duty , and assumes that it is possible to work toward public good .', 'Probing behind the press clipping , acclaimed urban historian Carl Abbott examines the character of contemporary Portland-its people , politics , and public life-and the region ’ s history and geography in order to discover how Portland has achieved its reputation as one of the most progressive and livable city in the United States and to determine whether typical pressure of urban growth are pushing Portland back toward the national norm .', 'In Greater Portland , Abbott argues that the city can not be understood without reference to its place .', 'Its river , hill , and broader regional setting have shaped the economy and the cityscape .', 'Portlanders are Oregonians , Northwesteners , Cascadians ; they value their city as much for where it is as for what it is , and this powerful sense of place nurtures a distinctive civic culture .', 'Tracing the way in which Portlanders have talked and thought about their city , Abbott reveals the tension between their diverse vision of the future and plan for development .', 'Most citizen of Portland desire a balance between continuity and change , one that supports urban progress but actively monitors its effect on the region ’ s expansive green space and on the community ’ s culture .', 'This strong civic participation in city planning and politics is what gives greater Portland its unique character , a positive setting for class integration , neighborhood revitalization , and civic value .', 'The result , Abbott confirms , is a region whose unique initiative remain a model of American urban planning .', 'Natural disaster and nuclear crisis in Japan : Response and recovery after Japan ’ s 3/11 .', 'The March 2011 earthquake and tsunami in Japan plunged the country into a state of crisis .', 'As the nation struggled to recover from a record breaking magnitude 9 earthquake and a tsunami that was as high as thirty-eight meter in some place , news trickled out that Fukushima had experienced meltdown in three reactor .', 'These tragic catastrophe claimed some 20,000 life , initially displacing some 500,000 people and overwhelming Japan ’ s formidable disaster preparedness.This book brings together the analysis and insight of a group of distinguished expert on Japan to examine what happened , how various institution and actor responded and what lesson can be drawn from Japan ’ s disaster .', 'The contributor , many of whom experienced the disaster first hand , assess the wide–ranging repercussion of this catastrophe and how it is already reshaping Japanese culture , politics , energy policy , and urban planning .', 'A city for all citizen : Integrating child and youth from marginalized population into city planning .', 'Socially just , intergenerational urban space should not only accommodate child and adolescent , but engage them as participant in the planning and design of welcoming space .', "With this goal , city agency in Boulder , Colorado , the Boulder Valley School District , the Children , Youth and Environments Center at the University of Colorado , and a number of community organization have been working in partnership to integrate young people 's idea and concern into the redesign of park and civic area and the identification of issue for city planning .", "Underlying their work is a commitment to the Convention on the Rights of the Child and child 's right to active citizenship from a young age .", 'This paper describes approach used to engage with young people and method of participation , and reflects on lesson learned about how to most effectively involve youth from underrepresented population and embed diverse youth voice into the culture of city planning .', 'Assessing the sustainability of Spanish city considering environmental and socio-economic indicator .', 'The conception of urban metabolism has considered the perspective of environmental sustainability in the framework of city .', 'In this context , city can be regarded complex entity driven by material and energy flow that entail consumption of resource and production of waste material in the pursuit of economic welfare and social progress .', 'According to a sustainability perspective , environmental , social and economic indicator must also be integrated into urban planning process .', 'However , methodological advance regarding the definition and development of sustainable city are required since a consensus of indicator , weighting and data management is still lacking .', 'In this paper , a multi-criteria approach that combine three methodology : Material Flow Analysis ( MFA ) , Life Cycle Assessment ( LCA ) and Data Envelopment Analysis ( DEA ) has been developed and applied to a sample of 26 representative Spanish city with different characteristic ( i.e.', ', population , location , demands , economy , topography and culture ) .', 'The combined approach allows identifying the non-sustainable city considering an offset of indicator from the three pillar of sustainability .', 'With this purpose , the mentioned item are implemented in a DEA model of efficiency , being the inefficient city with an efficiency score lower than 100 % defined as non-sustainable one .', 'Finally , this multi-criteria method allows setting the target value for the assessed indicator ( benchmarked value ) , which become objective for the non-sustainable city to evolve toward a more sustainable performance .', 'The outcome from the analysis have identified six city that ranked worse , with efficiency score ranging from 57.9 % to 85.8 % .', 'According to the target of socio-economic indicator , attention should be paid to AROPE rate ( people at risk of poverty and social exclusion ) , unemployment rate and number of crime , meanwhile lower level of electricity consumption , municipal solid waste and on-site greenhouse gas emission are desirable from an environmental perspective .', 'These outcome are of potential interest for politician , government and inhabitant to aid in the identification of the metabolic flow and social/economic indicator to be optimized in search of sustainability .', 'Brain culture : Shaping policy through neuroscience .', 'This unique book offers a timely analysis of the impact of rapidly advancing knowledge about the brain , mind and behaviour on contemporary public policy and practice .', 'Examining development in behaviour change policy , neuroscience , architecture and urban design , education , and workplace training programmes the book analyses the global spread of research agenda , policy experiment and everyday practice informed by ‘ brain culture ’ .It offers an alternative , geographically informed set of explanation for what matter in explaining how people behave and how citizen ’ behaviour should be governed .', 'It will be of interest to student and academic across the social and behavioural science .', 'The middle class in neoliberal China : Governing risk , life-building , and themed space .', "Since the late 1970s , China 's move towards neoliberalism has made it not only one of the world 's fastest growing economy , but also one of the most polarised state .", 'This economic , social and political transformation has led to the emergence of a new Chinese middle class , and understanding the development and the role of this new social group is crucial to understanding contemporary Chinese society .', 'Investigating the new politics of the middle class in China , this book addresses three major question .', 'First , how does the Chinese state deal with problem of national sovereignty and political representation to create the middle class both as a legitimate category of the people and as an ideal norm of citizenship ?', 'Second , how does the recognition of the middle class norm take place in the practice of everyday life ?', 'Finally , what kind of risk does the politics of the middle class generate not only for middle class subject but also for the disenfranchised ?', 'In answering these question , this book examines a set of practice , body of knowledge , measure , and institution that aim to manage , govern , control , and orient the behaviour , gesture , and thought of Chinese citizen .', 'This investigation contributes not only to the understanding of the Chinese middle class society but also to the scholarly debate over the relationship between governmental apparatus , subjectification , and life-building .', 'Drawing on ethnographic information , historical archive , and the medium , this book will be of great interest to student and scholar working in the field of Chinese study , Chinese politics , ethnic study and urban study , as well as those interested in culture , society , class and welfare .', 'Intellectual of empire : Eric Dutton and hegemony in British Africa .', 'This essay examines the career of Eric Dutton in five British African colony from 1919 to 1952 , with case study of his work in Lusaka and Zanzibar .', "In analyzing Dutton 's career , I use a Gramscian conception of the role of intellectual in creating colonial hegemony , against the backdrop of recent research on the relationship of geography to colonial discourse .", "Dutton worked and corresponded with key player in Britain 's African empire .", 'He was a major force behind early urban-planning program in East and Central Africa and author of four geographical book .', 'Permanently disabled by war wound , he was also permanently infatuated with the moral rightness of British imperial culture .', "A concern for geography 's professional relationship with , and the geographical legacy of , colonialism has emerged in recent scholarship on Africa , largely through study of travel writing , fiction , and nineteenth- or early twentieth-century exploration geography .", "Later scholar-officials like Dutton sought to apply their knowledge to the shaping of space to serve the Empire 's direct and immediate need in Africa , even while trying to win the heart and mind of its subject people .", "Around Timothy Mitchell 's ( 1988 ) concept of `` enframing , '' I build an analysis of the spatial project with which Dutton is most associated and show how Lusaka and Zanzibar were enframed by his plan .", 'Through his publication and correspondence , as well as his seemingly omnipresent service , Dutton has an important legacy that has neither been articulated nor analyzed , one which points to the importance of contextualized biography for analysis of colonial discourse .', 'I argue here for seeing Dutton as an intellectual in the service of colonial hegemony and its enframing spatial discourse , although the character of his agency exemplifies why that attempted hegemony failed .', 'Space , culture and urban design in late modernism and after .', 'Among the question underlying recent debate about the architecture of the city , two are perhaps more fundamental .', 'The first concerns the legitimacy of architectural practice : can we be assertive about how we should design our city without seeking to enforce social assumption which are ultimately authoritarian ?', 'The second concern architectural theory itself : can we be specific about what architecture does without being reductive about what society is ?', 'This article identifies and criticizes two kind of recent response to these question : the first is to defend an architecture of localism and containment in some new and some old way ; the second is to retreat into relativism , sometimes supported by the assertion that architecture is of limited consequence because society is increasingly independent of space .', 'The article defends the view that we can and must be assertive about the architecture of city in global rather than local term .', 'The experience of genuinely urban environment is about meeting , though not necessarily interacting with , other people , mostly unknown , who can be of recognizably different class , status , race or ethnic origin ; it is also about exploring the strange , and becoming aware of , though not necessarily participating in , other way of life .', '-from Author', "Imagining Portland 's urban growth boundary : Planning regulation as cultural icon .", "Problem : In the 30 year since its creation , has Portland , Oregon 's , urban growth boundary ( UGB ) become something more than a regulation ?", 'Spirited debate about its impact on land us and value has inspired vivid description by both supporter and critic and spurred the imagination of artist and creative writer .', 'Purpose : The UGB has become a symbol , metaphor , and touchstone , as people read complex meaning into it that go beyond its simple legal function .', 'This article looks at the UGB as a cultural icon .', 'It explores the increasingly complex way in which people have tried to describe , understand , and interpret the UGB as part of the regional landscape as well as the regulatory system .', 'It examines metaphorical description of the UGB as well as the growing body of depiction in nature writing , poetry , novel , photography , performance art , song , and other exercise of the artistic imagination .', 'Method : We review how supporter and critic of the UGB have described it and how artist have depicted it in various media.results and conclusion : Although many planning project have become icon , few planning regulation have done so .', 'Artistic interpretation have familiarized and humanized the UGB and embedded it in the consciousness of everyday life .', 'Artist thus make the invisible more visible or legible .', 'Acting as a viewfinder , the UGB offers an opportunity for conversation and interpretation from multiple perspective .', 'Takeaway for practice : In the world of 21st-century planning theory there is a strong assumption that many voice engaged in overlapping conversation can help shape more equitable and sustainable city .', "Creative depiction of Portland 's UGB show the role of cultural actor in shaping and enriching such conversation .", "'China 's leading historical and cultural city ' : Branding Dali City through public-private partnership in Bai architecture revitalization .", 'Competing with other Chinese city for investment and tourism , various governmental body with jurisdiction in Dali City have begun to make use of local historical and cultural asset in order to brand the city .', 'This paper aims to reveal how partnership between the public and private sector in heritage management have functioned as an approach to city branding , and how local people perceive and are influenced by these partnership .', "Applying perspective from the scholarly literature on city branding and public-private partnership , this paper examines two case in Dali City - Zhang 's Garden and the Linden Center - to detail how local government and elite entrepreneur have partnernered in support of Bai architecture revitalization with tourism in mind .", 'This paper also considers opinion from the local general public regarding these partnership , and investigates the complex relationship among local government , elite entrepreneur , and the public .', 'Uncovering inconspicuous place using social medium check-in and street view image .', 'There is a Chinese proverb , “ if your wine taste really good , you do not need to worry about the location of your bar ( 酒香不怕巷子深 ) ” , which implies that the popular place for local resident are sometimes hidden behind an unassuming door or on unexpected street .', 'Discovering these unassuming place ( e.g .', 'restaurant ) of a city will benefit the understanding of local culture and help to build livable neighborhood .', 'Previous work has been limited by the lack of appropriate data source and efficient tool to evaluate the popularity , ambiance and physical surroundings of place in large-scale urban area .', 'In addition , how to characterize place with respect to different group of people remains unclear .', 'In this work , we propose a data-driven approach using social medium check-in and street-level image to compare the different activity pattern of visitor and local , and uncover inconspicuous but interesting place for them in a city .', 'We use check-in record as a proxy of the popularity of a particular type of place , and differentiate visitor and local based on their travel and social medium behavior .', 'In addition , we employ street-level image to represent the physical environment of place .', 'As a result , we discovered a number of inconspicuous yet popular restaurant in Beijing .', 'These restaurant are located mostly in deep alley of Old Beijing neighborhood , where the physical environment are not particularly appealing ; however , these place are frequently visited by local for social engagement .', 'We also discovered beautiful but unpopular outdoor place in Beijing .', 'These place are potential recreational area for all group of people and could be improved regarding urban design and planning to make these public infrastructure more attractive .', 'This work demonstrates how multi-source big geo-data can be combined to build comprehensive place-based representation for different group of people .', 'Key contemporary society ?', 'What has the remarkable rise in festival and event meant for the development of tourism destination ; for the development of economy , be they local , national or
